fact_check_explanation_title: You don’t need to worry about that video claiming to show a snake in a pepper
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral video claims to show a poisonous snake in a pepper. It doesn’t.

fact_check_explanation_title: How long do child killers serve in prison?
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s possible for people who murder children to be given whole-life sentences, but the law doesn’t currently require this as a starting point in all cases.

fact_check_explanation_title: Were the Lib Dems the first party to campaign for an EU referendum?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Lib Dems were not the first party ever to campaign for an EU referendum, but they were the first major party to do so—advocating that the UK remain in …

fact_check_explanation_title: Jo Swinson said the Liberal Democrats supported an EU referendum in 2008
fact_check_explanation_summary: She also said in 2019 that she couldn’t forgive David Cameron for calling a referendum.

fact_check_explanation_title: Diane Abbott did not say an Iraqi migrant was found off the coast of a landlocked country
fact_check_explanation_summary: The unedited tweet was actually about a body found off the coast of Belgium.

fact_check_explanation_title: The ‘headline’ on this BBC article linked to by a Conservative Party Facebook ad isn’t the real headline
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Conservative Party Facebook advert seems to have altered the headline of a BBC article to make the government seem more generous than it’s being.

fact_check_explanation_title: We think there's a big error in that viral article about hedge funds and Brexit
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim that the number of “short positions” spiked when Boris Johnson became leader of the Conservative party seems to be a misreading of the data.

fact_check_explanation_title: There was not a 12kg rat in London
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of a rat makes it look deceptively big. It almost certainly weighed less than 3kg, rather than 12kg as claimed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo shows Jeremy Corbyn shaking hands with man previously jailed for electoral fraud
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook shows a genuine photo of Jeremy Corbyn shaking hands with Tariq Mahmood, who was convicted in 2008 for electoral fraud.

fact_check_explanation_title: John Major did prorogue parliament for three weeks in 1997
fact_check_explanation_summary: Major’s prorogation in 1997 delayed a report into Conservative MPs taking bribes, whether or not that was his intention.

fact_check_explanation_title: We can’t say how many people are ‘hooked on’ prescription drugs
fact_check_explanation_summary: Research by Public Health England into the prescribing of five specific types of drug found there wasn’t enough evidence to say how many people were addicted.

fact_check_explanation_title: The price of Freddos has risen five times faster than inflation
fact_check_explanation_summary: The price of Freddos has risen much faster than inflation, and so has the value of the minimum wage.
